conclusion: Determine the total energy stored in the cylindrical capacitor before any fluid rises.
Capacitance of a cylindrical capacitor in vacuum is given by C = (2 pi epsilon_0 l) / ln(b/a).
Energy stored in a capacitor is given by U = (1/2) C V^2.
Substitute the expression for C into the energy formula to get U = (1/2) (2 pi epsilon_0 l / ln(b/a)) V^2.
Simplify the expression to U = (pi epsilon_0 l V^2) / ln(b/a).
The total energy stored in the capacitor before any fluid rises is U = (pi epsilon_0 l V^2) / ln(b/a).
